description.text:
This protocol allows clients to control power management modes
    of outputs that are currently part of the compositor space. The
    intent is to allow special clients like desktop shells to power
    down outputs when the system is idle.

    To modify outputs not currently part of the compositor space see
    wlr-output-management.

    Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and
    backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes
    may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump.
    Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in
    the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version.
    Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the
    version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the
    interface version number is reset.
description.summary: Control power management modes of outputs

description.text:
This interface is a manager that allows creating per-output power
      management mode controls.
description.summary: manager to create per-output power management

description.text:
Create an output power management mode control that can be used to
        adjust the power management mode for a given output.
description.summary: get a power management for an output

description.text:
All objects created by the manager will still remain valid, until their
        appropriate destroy request has been called.

This object offers requests to set the power management mode of
      an output.
description.summary: adjust power management mode for an output

description.text:
Set an output's power save mode to the given mode. The mode change
        is effective immediately. If the output does not support the given
        mode a failed event is sent.
description.summary: Set an outputs power save mode

args.name: mode
args.summary: the power save mode to set

description.text: Destroys the output power management mode control object.

Report the power management mode change of an output.

        The mode event is sent after an output changed its power
        management mode. The reason can be a client using set_mode or the
        compositor deciding to change an output's mode.
        This event is also sent immediately when the object is created
        so the client is informed about the current power management mode.
description.summary: Report a power management mode change

args.name: mode
args.summary: the output's new power management mode

description.text:
This event indicates that the output power management mode control
        is no longer valid. This can happen for a number of reasons,
        including:
        - The output doesn't support power management
        - Another client already has exclusive power management mode control
          for this output
        - The output disappeared

        Upon receiving this event, the client should destroy this object.

entries.name: on
entries.summary: Output is turned on, no power saving
